title: A Ski Bar Fire in Switzerland
summary: A fire happened at a ski bar in Switzerland on New Year's Eve, and many people were hurt or died. Families are sad and surprised because the bar had not been checked for safety in five years. Officials said the bar should have been checked every year to make sure it was safe. The fire started when sparklers on champagne bottles lit up foam on the ceiling. The bar managers are being investigated, and they said they are very sorry. The mayor promised to ban sparklers in bars to prevent more fires. Most of the people who were hurt or died were young, and some are still in the hospital. This story shows why safety checks are important to keep people safe.

background_read: In Switzerland, bars and other places where people gather need to be checked regularly to make sure they are safe. This is called a safety inspection. It helps prevent accidents like fires. When a place is not checked, it can be dangerous because things like fire exits or materials might not be safe. This article talks about a fire that happened because sparklers were used in a bar, and it shows why rules and checks are important to protect everyone, especially young people who go to these places.
Article_Structure: WHO: Families of victims, bar managers, mayor, and officials in Switzerland
WHAT: A fire at a ski bar caused by sparklers, with many injuries and deaths, and no safety checks for five years
WHERE: Le Constellation bar in Crans-Montana, Switzerland
WHY: To show the importance of safety inspections and the consequences when they are not done, leading to a tragic event

perspectives.description: They are shocked and sad because the bar was not checked for safety, which they believe could have prevented the fire.
They admit mistakes and promise to take responsibility, like banning sparklers, to improve safety in the future.
